solution_line_template: First figure out how many tiles are in one row by dividing the kitchen's width by each tile's width: {kitchen_width} inches / {tile_width} inches/tile = <<{kitchen_width}/{tile_width}={tiles_in_one_row}>>{tiles_in_one_row} tiles in one row

Then figure out how many rows of tiles there are by dividing the kitchen's height by each tile's height: {kitchen_height} inches / {tile_width} inches/tile = <<{kitchen_height}/{tile_width}={number_of_rows}>>{number_of_rows} rows of tiles

Then multiply the number of rows by the number of tiles per row to find the total number of tiles Kimiko needs to buy: {tiles_in_one_row} tiles/row * {number_of_rows} rows = <<{tiles_in_one_row}*{number_of_rows}={total_tiles}>>{total_tiles} tiles
